description.narrative: Funding under this initiative provides assistance to address the needs of conflict and disaster affected people from Burma living in refugee camps on the Thai-Burma border and humanitarian assistance to displaced people within Burma as needs arise. Specifically, the initiative will provide: basic health care and education for refugees on the Thai-Burma border; food assistance to the most vulnerable households; training and livelihood support in preparation for a safe and voluntary return home when conditions permit; access to information so refugees are able to make informed decisions about their future; and increased integration of service delivery components with the Myanmar Government and/or international non-government organisations' services. The initiative also includes the provision of support to the UN OCHA as a contingency fund for emergency response activities in Burma. The total value of this initiative is $28.0 million over 3 years, starting 2013-14.
